trans-unit.source: Setting the SQL standard authorization mode

seg-source.mrk: Setting the SQL standard authorization mode

target.mrk: Setting the SQL standard authorization mode

trans-unit.source: If you use NATIVE authentication, SQL standard authorization is automatically enabled. Otherwise, use the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property to enable SQL standard authorization.

seg-source.mrk: If you use NATIVE authentication, SQL standard authorization is automatically enabled.
Otherwise, use the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property to enable SQL standard authorization.

target.mrk: If you use NATIVE authentication, SQL standard authorization is automatically enabled.
Otherwise, use the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property to enable SQL standard authorization.

seg-source.mrk: databases

target.mrk: databases

seg-source.mrk: SQL standard authorization, setting

target.mrk: SQL standard authorization, setting

seg-source.mrk: derby.database.sqlAuthorization property

target.mrk: derby.database.sqlAuthorization property

seg-source.mrk: properties

target.mrk: properties

seg-source.mrk: derby.database.sqlAuthorization

target.mrk: derby.database.sqlAuthorization

trans-unit.source: If SQL standard authorization mode is enabled, object owners can grant and revoke permission for other users to perform actions on database objects. SQL standard authorization mode also controls users' ability to create, set, and drop roles.

seg-source.mrk: If SQL standard authorization mode is enabled, object owners can grant and revoke permission for other users to perform actions on database objects.
SQL standard authorization mode also controls users' ability to create, set, and drop roles.

target.mrk: If SQL standard authorization mode is enabled, object owners can grant and revoke permission for other users to perform actions on database objects.
SQL standard authorization mode also controls users' ability to create, set, and drop roles.

trans-unit.source: The valid settings for the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property are:

seg-source.mrk: The valid settings for the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property are:

target.mrk: The valid settings for the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property are:

seg-source.mrk: <varname>TRUE</varname>

target.mrk: <varname>TRUE</varname>

seg-source.mrk: <varname>FALSE</varname>

target.mrk: <varname>FALSE</varname>

trans-unit.source: The default setting for the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property is <varname>FALSE</varname>, unless NATIVE authentication is enabled.

seg-source.mrk: The default setting for the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property is <varname>FALSE</varname>, unless NATIVE authentication is enabled.

target.mrk: The default setting for the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property is <varname>FALSE</varname>, unless NATIVE authentication is enabled.

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property is usable only if the property <codeph>derby.connection.requireAuthentication</codeph> is also set to true, since SQL authorization is of no value unless authentication is also enabled. (With NATIVE authentication, both are enabled automatically.)

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property is usable only if the property <codeph>derby.connection.requireAuthentication</codeph> is also set to true, since SQL authorization is of no value unless authentication is also enabled.
(With NATIVE authentication, both are enabled automatically.)

target.mrk: The <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property is usable only if the property <codeph>derby.connection.requireAuthentication</codeph> is also set to true, since SQL authorization is of no value unless authentication is also enabled.
(With NATIVE authentication, both are enabled automatically.)

trans-unit.source: After you set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property to <varname>TRUE</varname>, you cannot set the property back to <varname>FALSE</varname>.

seg-source.mrk: After you set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property to <varname>TRUE</varname>, you cannot set the property back to <varname>FALSE</varname>.

target.mrk: After you set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property to <varname>TRUE</varname>, you cannot set the property back to <varname>FALSE</varname>.

trans-unit.source: You can set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a system property or as a database property. If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled. If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.

seg-source.mrk: You can set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a system property or as a database property.
If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled.
If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.

target.mrk: You can set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a system property or as a database property.
If you set this property as a system property before you create the databases, all new databases will automatically have SQL authorization enabled.
If the databases already exist, you can set this property only as a database property.

trans-unit.source: To enable SQL standard authorization for the entire system, set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a system property:

seg-source.mrk: To enable SQL standard authorization for the entire system, set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a system property:

target.mrk: To enable SQL standard authorization for the entire system, set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a system property:

seg-source.mrk: derby.database.sqlAuthorization=true

target.mrk: derby.database.sqlAuthorization=true

trans-unit.source: To enable SQL standard authorization for a specific database, set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a database property:

seg-source.mrk: To enable SQL standard authorization for a specific database, set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a database property:

target.mrk: To enable SQL standard authorization for a specific database, set the <codeph>derby.database.sqlAuthorization</codeph> property as a database property:

seg-source.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.database.sqlAuthorization', 'true')

target.mrk: CALL SYSCS_UTIL.SYSCS_SET_DATABASE_PROPERTY( 'derby.database.sqlAuthorization', 'true')
